metadata.title: CVE-2020-15983 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in webUI in Google Chrome on ChromeOS prior to86.0.4240.75 allowed a local attacker to bypass content security policy viaa crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
